articles.title: Liberia : Afcon 2025 Kicks Off With Record $10m Prize
articles.summary: The 35th edition of the TotalEnergies CAF Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) burst into action this weekend, ushering in a new era for African football defined by unprecedented prize money and a commanding opening performance by host nation Morocco. On the eve of the tournament, Confederation of African Football (CAF) President Dr. Patrice Motsepe announced a historic 43 percent increase in prize money for the champions. articles.title: Somalia : Funding Cuts Impact Assistance to Millions Affected By Drought
articles.summary: Brutal slashes to aid budgets are hampering efforts to assist millions of people in Somalia affected by drought, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said on Monday. More than 4.6 million people across the country, roughly a quarter of the population, are impacted, according to local authorities. articles.title: Major stampedes of 2025 in India : Maha Kumbh , Karur stampede and more
articles.summary: From religious festivals to sporting celebrations, fan frenzy to political campaigns, the year 2025 witnessed a number of crowd crush and stampedes, leading to over 100 deaths this year. While what triggered these stampedes could vary, poor crowd management and a lack of proper public infrastructure cannot be ignored. Almost 80% of stampedes in India occur at religious gatherings or pilgrimages. Here are some of the major stampedes that made head
